page.title: 16Wittersham Church & School
page.content: {Wittersham Church}is dedicated to St.John the Baptist and there was probably an Anglo-Saxon wooden church here. The surviving base of the church dates from around 1200 and the South aisle was built in the early 14th century. The bell tower was added about a hundred years later and houses a ring of bells. The newest addition, the Tower Room, built for small meetings, was dedicated in 1978. {The Primary School}was opened on 28th October 1874. The Hall and Television Room are the oldest parts of the building but there are 3 modern classrooms built about 28 years ago and a mobile classroom. We think we have the best Primary School swimming pool in Kent built for us by the P.T.A. There are 84 children in the school aged between 5 and 11 and there are 4 teachers.
